meta.content: This is an example page. It’s different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this: Hi there! I’m a bike messenger […]

section.p: All on-site classes are cancelled through May 15 by order of the Governor. All information on Coronavirus Covid-19 and Shenendehowa’s K-12 online learning and resources for students can be found here.

img.alt: Members of the World Language Honor Society hosted their first International Movie Night in February. The audience learned about important traditions and symbolism of the Mexican holiday Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead), and then viewed the Spanish-language version of the movie Coco.

div.strong: Members of the World Language Honor Society hosted their first International Movie Night. The audience learned about important traditions and symbolism of the Mexican holiday Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead), and then viewed the Spanish-language version of the movie Coco.

img.alt: To conclude the month of February, Ms. Ann Schwanda visited us and provided both Karigon and Orenda’ s 4th and 5th grade classes with a very informative presentation on the significance of quilts and the Underground Railroad.

img.alt: Contemporary artist and Orenda parent, Domingo Zapata spent two days in the art room with Orenda 4th and 5th graders. Art workshops focused on creating from the heart with feeling.

div.strong: Contemporary artist and Orenda parent, Domingo Zapata spent two days in the art room with Orenda 4th and 5th graders. Art workshops focused on creating from the heart with feeling. More photos…

img.alt: In February, 22 high school students and German teachers Herr Hutson and Frau Bennett traveled to Germany for a two-week homestay program in Cologne. Students lived with German host families and visited our partner school, Stadtgymnasium Köln-Porz. Highlights of the exchange experience also included trips to Aachen, the Moselle River Valley, the birthplace of Beethoven, history and art museums, castles, cathedrals, and even a private tour of the German parliament in Berlin. If you would like to learn more about the Shen German American Partnership Program (Shen GAPP), be sure to visit our table at Shensational on March 21 in the HSE Global Village!

div.strong: In February, 22 high school students and German teachers Herr Hutson and Frau Bennett traveled to Germany for a two-week homestay program in Cologne. More info and photos…
